title: Get support from the community
content:
Agent users can get support about how to implement and use Service Management directly from the product UI by simply clicking the Community option from the avatar menu in the agent interface. 

This option directs agent users to the Service Management community, where they can get help from live videos, discussions, blog posts, and other resources, as well as share their thoughts and experiences.

How to customize the community URL

Use the steps applicable to your deployment to customize the community URL.

Classic deployment

Out of the box, the Community option points to the Service Management community. If you want to change the URL to your own, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to a control plane node (in an embedded Kubernetes environment) or the bastion node (in a managed Kubernetes environment).
  2. Run the following command (replace <suite namespace> with your own namespace such as itsma-ae6li):  
    kubectl edit cm itom-xruntime-infra-config -n <suite namespace>
  3. Locate the following line: 
    COMMUNITY_ITSM_URL:https://community.microfocus.com/t5/SMAX-Suite/ct-p/ITSMA_Suite
  4. Update the URL to your own. 
  5. Restart the itom-xruntime-platform  pods as follows: 
    • Run the following command to obtain the replicas value of the itom-xruntime-platform  deployment: 
      kubectl get po -n <suite namespace> | grep platform

      The number of the itom-xruntime-platform pods is the replicas value. For example, the following output indicates the replicas value is 2.

      itom-xruntime-platform-6cf484cd96-jwtlv     2/2     Running     0     10m
itom-xruntime-platform-6cf484cd96-ljwf5     2/2     Running     0     10m
    • Stop the pods: 
       kubectl scale deployment/itom-xruntime-platform -n <suite namespace> --replicas=0
    • Wait until the pods are stopped. 
    • Start the pods (change <original replicas> to the original replicas value). 
      kubectl scale deployment/itom-xruntime-platform -n <suite namespace> --replicas=<original replicas>
  6. Log in to the agent interface, and click Community from the avatar menu to check that your own URL opens.

Helm deployment

 The steps to customize the community URL for helm deployment is applied to the xruntime-infra configMap file.

  1. [Optional] If you don't remember the path of your custom my-values.yaml file, run the following command to get your yaml file. 
    helm get values <ESM_RELEASE_NAME> -n <ESM_NAMESPACE> > my-values.yaml

    Where:

    • <ESM_RELEASE_NAME> is the release name, which you can obtain by using the following command: 
      helm list -n <ESM_NAMESPACE> | awk '{print $1}'
       
    • <ESM_NAMESPACE> is the unique namespace of the Service Management deployment.

  2. Update  xruntime.communityITSMUrl in your values yaml to your own.

    xruntime:
  communityITSMUrl: https://community.microfocus.com/t5/SMAX-Suite/ct-p/ITSMA_Suite
  3. Run the following command to clean up unused jobs before applying the changes.  
    kubectl get job -n <ESM_NAMESPACE>|grep -v NAME | awk '{print $1}'|xargs kubectl delete job -n <ESM_NAMESPACE>

    Where <ESM_NAMESPACE> is the unique namespace of the Service Management deployment.

  4. Run the following command to apply the changes: 
    helm upgrade <ESM_RELEASE_NAME> -n <ESM_NAMESPACE>  <ESM_HELM_CHART_PATH> -f my-values.yaml

    Where:

    Example:

    helm upgrade sma -n itsma ESM_Helm_Chart-2x.x.x/charts/esm-1.0.0+2x.x-xxx.tgz -f my-values.yaml
    • <ESM_RELEASE_NAME> is the release name, which you can obtain by using the following command: 
      helm list -n <ESM_NAMESPACE> | awk '{print $1}'
    • <ESM_HELM_CHART_PATH>:  The absolute path of the helm package.
  5. Restart the itom-xruntime-platform  pods as follows: 
    • Run the following command to obtain the replicas value of the itom-xruntime-platform  deployment: 
      kubectl get po -n <suite namespace> | grep platform

      The number of the itom-xruntime-platform pods is the replicas value. For example, the following output indicates the replicas value is 2.

      itom-xruntime-platform-6cf484cd96-jwtlv     2/2     Running     0     10m
itom-xruntime-platform-6cf484cd96-ljwf5     2/2     Running     0     10m
    • Stop the pods: 
       kubectl scale deployment/itom-xruntime-platform -n <suite namespace> --replicas=0
    • Wait until the pods are stopped. 
    • Start the pods (change <original replicas> to the original replicas value). 
      kubectl scale deployment/itom-xruntime-platform -n <suite namespace> --replicas=<original replicas>
  6. Log in to the agent interface, and click Community from the avatar menu to check that your own URL opens.
